intro: Huchimingia weizhii, commonly known as the Guangxi honghua, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive red flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountainous regions. Its botanical features include lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
